intro: Bignonia meonantha, commonly known as the creeping bignonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow-orange, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces long, slender seed pods that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Bignonia meonantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to climb or trail along structures.
